# center

**Instance Property**

The center point of the plane relative to its anchor position.

## Declaration

```swift
var center: simd_float3 { get }
```

## Discussion

When ARKit first detects a plane, the resulting [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneAnchor] object has a [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneAnchor/center] value of `(0,0,0)`, indicating that the translation portion of the anchor’s [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARAnchor/transform] value locates the plane’s center point.

As scene analysis and plane detection continues, ARKit may determine that a previously detected plane anchor is part of a larger real-world surface, increasing the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneAnchor/extent] width and length values. The plane’s new boundaries may not be symmetric around its initial position, so the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARPlaneAnchor/center] point changes relative to the anchor’s (unchanged) [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARAnchor/transform] matrix.

Although the type of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/simd/vector_float3], a plane anchor is always two-dimensional, and is always positioned in only the x and z directions relative to its [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARAnchor/transform] position. (That is, the y-component of this vector is always zero.)

## Dimensions

- **planeExtent**: The estimated width, length, and y-axis rotation of the detected plane.
- **ARPlaneExtent**: The size and y-axis rotation of a detected plane.
- **extent**: The estimated width and length of the detected plane.
